question: in the honour of which god is anant chaturdashi celebrated
chain_of_thought_result: Anant Chaturdashi is celebrated in honor of Lord Vishnu. It marks the end of the Ganesh Chaturthi festival and is observed on the 14th day of the waxing moon in the month of Bhadrapada. On this day, devotees worship Lord Vishnu and also perform rituals to bid farewell to Lord Ganesha, who is immersed in water after the festival.
